SEC Shut Off Extra Security on X For About 6 Months, Letting Hacker Breeze In https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2024/01/22/sec-shut-off-extra-security-on-x-for-7-months-letting-hacker-breeze-in/?utm_medium=referral&utm_source =rss&utm_campaign=头条新闻IEBBLMYKLFCOHPAFXUWTGG6MTQ Jesse HamiltonThe U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) confirmed that a hacker took over its X account through a "SIM swap" attack that seized control of a cell phone associated with the account. That allowed the outsider to falsely tweet on January 9 that the agency had approved spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs), a day before the agency actually did so. Mon, 22 Jan 2024 21:00:00 +0000 2024-01-22T21:24:03.385+00:00 PolicynewsRegulationsHackBitcoin ETFTwitterSecurities and Exchange CommissionChair Gary Gensler's U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission confirmed its bitcoin ETF hack was a "SIM swap." (Jesse Hamilton/CoinDesk)杰西·汉密尔顿
